nodes.bodyText: Why is this test here? Will the test fail for this class if it's removed? Or is it here as a reminder if some developer later adds class-specific name validation?

This test overrides the generic test that system names without a prefix and text "$:" should fail with exception.
This could be a perfectly valid system name for some managers, hence the test won't work for all scenarios, especially those that don't perform any type of custom validation.
Does the "@todo" annotation feel OK or should it be removed?

https://www.jmri.org/help/en/html/doc/Technical/JUnit.shtml
ToDo is used when the test needs more work to function correctly.
In this case, I think it would be better to change it to a simple comment, since this test is not relevant for this class.
Thanks for the comment Daniel, makes sense.
